metadata.title: CVE-2022-0487 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in rtsx_usb_ms_drv_remove indrivers/memstick/host/rtsx_usb_ms.c in memstick in the Linux kernel. Inthis flaw, a local attacker with a user privilege may impact systemConfidentiality. This flaw affects kernel versions prior to 5.14 rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
